alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Christian; Hopkins; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 10:12PM EDT until July 17 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Christian County in south central Kentucky... Southeastern Caldwell County in western Kentucky... Northern Trigg County in western Kentucky... Southern Hopkins County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 911 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles north of Princeton to Canton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hopkinsville, Madisonville, Princeton, Dawson Springs, Cadiz, Energy Lake Campground, Land Between The Lakes Area, Earlington, Nortonville, Mortons Gap, Crofton, Olney, Cobb, Rockcastle, White Plains, St. Charles and Hawkins. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 55 and 74. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 81 and 113. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 43. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 5 and 34. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
